Jamia Millia Islamia Admissions
What’s new?

Jamia Millia Islamia admissions 2025 are open to various courses. A few more updates are as follows:

  • NEET UG 2025 registration has opened for admission to the MBBS/BDS courses, and the last date to register is Mar 7, 2025. The NEET UG 2025 exam is to be conducted on May 4, 2025.
  • The NEET PG Counselling 2024 stray vacancy round has ended with the seat allotment result declaration for admission to the MD, MS, and PG Diploma courses.
  • The CUET PG 2025 exam dates have been revised for admission to PG courses. As per the notification, the exam is scheduled to be held between Mar 13, 2025, and Apr 1, 2025.
  • The CUET UG registration 2025 is open for admission to UG courses, and the last date to register is Mar 22, 2025. Additionally, the CUET UG 2025 exam will be conducted tentatively between May 8 and Jun 1, 2025.
  • MBA/BEd (ODL) mode, and BA/BCom/BBA/MCom/MA/UG Diploma/PG Diploma (OL) mode applications are closed for Feb 2025 session. Further, the entrance test for MBA/BEd (ODL) is to be held on Mar 1, 2025.

Jamia Millia Islamia Admission Process 2025

Jamia Millia Islamia admission 2025 is based on entrance exam score. The university released its prospectus for admissions in March with the schedule for admission to courses accepting national-level and university-level entrance exams. JMI, New Delhi offers over 220 courses in both regular and self-financed modes. The university also provides distance learning courses at undergraduate (UG), postgraduate (PG), and diploma levels.

Find below the Jamia Millia Islamia admission process infographics:

Jamia Milia Islamia Admission 2025: Highlights

JMI has entered into MoU with Indian Air Force, Indian Navy, Indian Army, and Indian Coast Guard that permits the defense personnel to undertake degrees and diplomas through distance mode offered at CDOL in one sitting. The entire process involved in Jamia Millia Islamia course admissions is described below in detail:

Jamia Millia Islamia Admission 2025: Eligibility & Selection

JMI course admission for a majority of UG programmes is provided via numerous entrance exams, such as the JMI entrance exam and CUET, etc. Candidates who are appearing for the Jamia CUET exam can download the JMI admit card before the test.

Additionally, JMI admission for a majority of postgraduate programmes is offered via an entrance exam, namely the JMI entrance exam. Eligible students can register online by visiting the official website of the University. The below table mentions the top JMI courses along with their eligibility and selection criteria:

Jamia Millia Islamia Fees 2025: Affordability & ROI

The different components included in Jamia Millia Islamia fees are tuition fees, security deposits, hostel fees, mess fees, etc. The hostel fee at JMI for BSc and BTech is INR 4,800. Candidates shall be able to pay the fee annually or semester-wise. Below is the Jamia Milia Islamia fee for the popular courses:

Jamia Millia Islamia Seats 2025

Jamia Milia Islamia's seat intake varies course-wise. The seat intake for Bachelor of Technology (BTech) programme is more 1,000, while Bachelor of Commerce (BCom) has a lesser capacity to fill the students. Candidates can get a seat either based on their merit or entrance exam score. Below are JMI courses along with the seat intake:

Step for Jamia Millia Islamia Admission Process 2025

For the first time, students willing to appear for JMI admission were required to pass the Common University Entrance Test (CUET). The admission process is completely online for all courses. Mentioned below is a checklist that you can not miss if you are a Jamia Millia Islamia aspirant:

Step 1: Application

Candidates must apply for CUET and appear for the exam. JMI accepts admission to three UG courses via CUET, namely, BA, BSc, and BVoc in specific specialisations. To know the exact courses and their details, download this PDF

Step 2: Registration

After the CUET UG result is out, those who have qualified for the exam must register at https://www.jmi.ac.in/ by paying the application fee (fee cost not available officially).

Step 3: Counselling Process

Selected candidates must attend the counselling round. Admission is offered based on a merit list prepared by JMI.

Step 4: Final Admission

Candidates need to report and pay the admission fee to confirm the seat in their desired programme.

Before appearing for CUET:

  • What subject should one take CUET in? As per guidelines released by Jamia, candidates must take CUET 2024 only in subjects that they have cleared in Class 12.
  • Are you eligible? Students will also have to clear the Class 12 exam to be eligible for admission.
  • What's the exam pattern? The entrance test will consist of three sections with objective-type questions (MCQs). Check the CUEthe T Exam Pattern here and download the JMI CUET UG admit card before the exam.
  • What's the CtheUET syllabus? The exam will be strictly based on the Class 12 NCERT syllabus (according to media reports).
  • In how many languages can one appear for CUET 2024? There are a total of 13 languages (Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, Marathi, Gujarati, Odiya, Bengali, Assamese, Punjabi, English, Hindi and Urdu).

More details here: Jamia Millia Islamia Prospectus 2023-24

Commonly asked questions
On Admissions

Q:   How can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

Aspiring students are required to register on the official website of CUET fill the application form online. In the form, fill all the details asked, upload the required documents and pay the application fee. Starting 2022, for BA, BSc and BVoc, JMI started accepting the scores of CUET UG. For the same, students need to register for the exam, appear for it and qualify it. Qualified students of CUET UG are required to register for JMI counselling after which merit lists will be released with the name of the shortlisted students. For the remaining courses, however, the university is still accepting national and university-level entrance exam for final selection. 

Upvote

Q:   What is the reservation percentage for Muslim candidates at JMI?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia offers seat reservations in almost all the courses based on the category of the students. Candidates seeking JMI admission under the reserved category can apply for reservation under one category only and are required to fulfil the prescribed eligibility conditions of the course. More details regarding JMI reservation criteria are enlisted below:

  • 30% of the total number of seats in each course are reserved for Muslim applicants. 10% of the total number of seats in each course are reserved for women applicants
    who are Muslims and 10% of the total number of seats in each course shall be earmarked for (OBCs) and ST students who are Muslims.
  • 5% of seats in all the courses are reserved for physically challenged students.
  • 5% of seats in all courses must be filled by internal students of Jamia who have passed their qualifying exam from Jamia schools as regular students.

More details on the reservation criteria and relaxation offered to students across course eligibility are available in the official 2023 prospectus of JMI.

Upvote

Q:   Does Jamia Millia Islamia accept CUET score?

A: 

Yes, Jamia Millia Islamia accepts CUET scores for UG courses such as BA, BSc and BVoc. Jamia Millia Islamia admission 2025 is based on entrance exam score. The university released its prospectus for admissions in March with the schedule for admission to courses accepting national-level and university-level entrance exams. JMI, New Delhi offers over 220 courses in both regular and self-financed modes. The university also provides distance learning courses at undergraduate (UG), postgraduate (PG), and Diploma levels.

Upvote

Q:   Is Jamia Millia Islamia good for MBA?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia is a renowned university and offers a two-year Master of Business Administration (MBA) programme. The success of doing an MBA from Jamia Millia Islamia or any other university depends on several factors such as the quality of the course, the reputation of the university, placement opportunities that students get from that university.

  • Quality of MBA: To furtnish the quality aspect of MBA from Jamia, the MBA course of Jamia Millia Islamia is accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA) and is recognised by the University Grants Commission (UGC).
  • Reputation: Every year, companies, such as Honda, Accenture, FedEx, Tata, HDFC Bank, Zomato and Adobe visit the campus of Jamia Millia Islamia to hire the students of MBA as mentioned by a few students in their verified students reviews' on Shiksha. Participation of such top-notch companies proove that Jamia is a reputed name in the industry for its MBA education.
  • Opportunities to the students: As per the details collated from various sources on the internet, students who actively participate in extracurricular activities, internships, and networking opportunities are know to have a more successful career after completing the MBA programme from here. Every year, 70-90% students get jobs from the campus and the salary packages ranges between INR 4 LPA to INR 13 LPA. 

As per the above factors, an MBA from Jamia Millia Islamia can be counted as a valuable asset for individuals looking to advance their career in the field of Business and Management considering they are ready to put in their efforts and hadwork in the course duration. 

Upvote

Q:   What is the fee for MBA at Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

The total tuition fee for MBA at Jamia Millia Islamia ranges between INR 38,500 - INR 3 lakh. The range indicates that the fee across all MBA specialisations is different. In addition to the tuition fee, students are also required to pay the application form charges which is INR 700 for the course. The afore-mentioned tution fee, however, is sourced from various sources on the internet. Hence, is indicative. For the exact fee and specialisation-wise fee break-up for different MBA specialisations, students can reach out to the admission office or check out the JMI Official Prospectus 2023-24.

Upvote

Commonly asked questions
On B.A. Admissions

Q:   I've scored less than 60% in 12th boards, can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia offers BA and BA (Hons) in multiple specialisations. The minimum percentage that a candidate must have scored in Class 12 to be eligible for BA at Jamia Millia Islamia ranges from 45% to 50% for different specialisations. Hence, a candidate scoring 60% in Class 12 is eligible to apply for BA admission at the institute. However, meeting the minimum eligibility criteria does not guarantee admission to the BA courses of Jamia Millia Islamia. Candidates must have a valid score of the accepted entrance exams to get an admission. In case a candidate fails to clear the entrance exam cut-off required for BA admission at Jamia Millia Islamia, they can look for other colleges/universities offering similar courses. The can also check out the colleges/institutes offering Online BA courses. 

Upvote

Q:   What is the eligibility criteria for BA (Hons) at JMI?

A: 

Candidates seeking admission to Jamia Millia Islamia for BA must have passed Class 12 or SSC with a minimum aggregate ranging from 40-50%. The passing percentage is different for different specialisations offered in the BA programme. With an annual intake of over 900 students for BA and BA (Hons) programmes (including all the specialisations), admission to Jamia Millia Islamia for BA and BA (Hons) is subject to either CUET (conducted by NTA) or JMI entrance exam. Till 2021, admission was subject to the JMI entrance exam across all specialisations. However, starting 2022, admission to a few BA (Hons) specialisations is CUET-based and for the rest, it is university-level entrance-based.

Upvote

Jamia Millia Islamia offers M.A. programme across 35 specialisations. It is a two-year programme, admission to which is based on a candidate’s performance in JMI Entrance Exam. Commonly asked questions
On M.A. Admissions

Q:   How can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia for MA?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia offers a two-year MA programme to the stduents across more than 30 specialisations. It is a two-year programme spread over four semesters, admission to which is based on a candidate’s performance in JMI Entrance Exam. The final merit list for admission to MA at JMI is prepared on the basis of the candidate’s performance in the entrance test, seat reservation and relaxation criteria of JMI. The application fee for MA range from INR 550 - INR 700 for different courses and interested candidates can apply online on the official website of Jamia Millia Islamia. 

Upvote

Q:   Is MA available at Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

Yes, MA course is available at Jamia Millia Islamia. The institute offers MA courses at the PG level. Candidate must meet the eligibility criteria to enroll for MA course admission set by the college. Aspirants must pass Any UG degree with at least 50%-55% aggregate. JMI admission process is JMI Entrance Exam.

Jamia Millia Islamia MBA admission is completely entrance-based at Jamia Millia Islamia University. Commonly asked questions
On MBA/PGDM Admissions

Q:   How can I take admission to JMI for MBA?

A: 

Candidates seeking admission to Jamia Millia Islamia for MBA can apply online on the official website. Admission to this course is offered based on the entrance exam conducted by the university, i.e. JMI Entrance Eest. Interested candidates must have a relevant bachelor’s degree with at least 50% aggregate in the subject concerned. Followed by application filling and before application submission, candidates are also required to pay the application fee which ranges from INR 550 to INR 700. A step-by-step process of application is mentioned below:

  1. Visit the official website and scroll down.
  2. On the Admission section in the left corner of the page, there are multiple links for course-wise application forms.
  3. Click on the desired courses' application link, fill out the application form and pay the application fee.
Upvote

Q:   How are Jamia Millia Islamia MBA placements?

A: 

According to media reports, the highest package offered during JMI MBA phase 1 placements 2023 stood at INR 25 LPA. Further, as per the Management NIRF report 2024 released by Jamia Millia Islamia, the key highlights of JMI MBA placements over the past three years are presented below:

Upvote

Q:   I've scored less than 60% in graduation, can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia for MBA?

A: 

As per the eligibility criteria specified for MBA admission at Jamia Millia Islamia, candidates must have completed their undergraduate degree from a recognised university with at least 50% aggregate or equivalent grade. Hence, a candidate scoring over 50% in their graduation is eligible to apply for MBA at JMI. However, meeting the eligibility criteria does not ensure a seat allotment at the institute. Candidates seeking MBA admission must have a valid score of JMI Entrance Test. In case a candidate is unable to secure the required cut-off for MBA at Jamia Millia Islamia, they can opt for some other college/university for pursuing MBA in their desired specialisation. They can also check out the colleges offering Online MBA courses.

Jamia Millia Islamia Application Process 2025

Candidates can complete the Jamia Millia Islamia Application process online. To register for admission candidates are required to use the online form available at JMI’s Admission Portal:(www.jmicoe.in, www.jmi.ac.in). The Online Form submission process consists of two-phases viz. Candidate’s Registration and Entrance Application Submission.The steps to fill out the JMI application form are mentioned below:

Step 1: Fill the registration form with correct details like name and date of birth. Also Soft copy of candidate’s coloured passport size photograph and Soft copy of candidate’s signature.

Step 2: After completion of registration, candidates will receive a unique CODE with a link to verify the email account, and login (email ID), Password.

Step 3 - Upload the required documents.

Step 4 - Pay the JMI application fee.

Q:   How do I apply for admission to various courses at Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

Candidates can complete the Jamia Millia Islamia Application process online. To register for admission candidates are required to use the online form available at JMI's Admission Portal: (jmicoe.in, jmi.ac.in). The Online Form submission process consists of two-phases viz. Candidate's Registration and Entrance Application Submission.The steps to fill out the JMI application form are mentioned below:

Step 1: Fill the registration form with correct details like name and date of birth. Also Soft copy of candidate's coloured passport size photograph and Soft copy of candidate's signature.

Step 2: After completion of registration, candidates will receive a unique CODE with a link to verify the email account, and login (email ID), Password.

Step 3 - Upload the required documents.

Step 4 - Pay the JMI application fee.

Q:   What are the documents required for MBA admission at Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

Below-mentioned documents have to be attached along with the duly-filed application form for applying to any of the distance learning courses offered at JMI:

  • Three passport-size photographs
  • Class 10 and Class 12 mark sheet and certificate (original and photocopy)
  • Graduation mark sheet and certificate (original and photocopy)
  • Character certificate from the Institution last attended (in original)
  • Migration/ Transfer Certificate from the last attended institution
  • Copy of the Aadhaar Card

Review of Jamia Millia Islamia.
Placements: In my department, many students get placed in respective organisations. Renowned organisation visit our college every year to recruit students like Vidanta, Trident Group, Empower Pragati, etc. The placement process is held in three rounds. In the first round, interested students are given a topic to write. 2nd round is a group discussion and the third is a personal interview.
Infrastructure: Everything is good here. It provides different kinds of seminars and different departments organise seminars related to their subjects. I attended many seminars on sociology. Hostel rooms are good, which come on a sharing basis. For undergraduate students, 3 sharing rooms are allotted whereas for masters and PhD students, 2 sharing rooms are available. There are two campuses for boys hostels with 6 hostels altogether. The students taking capacity is around 400. Hostels are tough to get and we need to have a good academic background to get a hostel, and normally points are given on the basis of academic background.
Faculty: The syllabus is according to the needs of the current scenario with a wide variety of subjects from the fundamentals level to the advanced level. The fieldwork is an integral part of the curriculum, so the students are allotted 2 organizations in the entire course, one for each year with different fieldwork objectives for each semester to get the students equipped with the round reality. Faculty members are the best in their fields. The head of the courses are gold medallists from their time and impart a knowledge unparalleled which gets one to love the subjects.

Jamia Millia Islamia Admission FAQs 2025

Q:   Is Jamia's entrance exam tough?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia is considered to be one of the top universities to pursue undergraduate, postgraduate, and advanced Diploma programmes, and students from all around the country and abroad aspire to be a part of this renowned university. Jamia conducts JMI Entrance Exam for admission to most of its undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Each year the bar is raised and the exam along with the competition only becomes tougher. To successfully clear the JMI Entrance Exam, candidates have to study hard, prepare well, know the syllabus thoroughly. pattern, marking scheme and the syllabus thoroughly. A candidate must put in plenty of time and dedication to ace the exam. A step-by-step preparation strategy for the exam is as follows:

  1. Know the JMI Entrance Exam syllabus thoroughly.
  2. Understand the JMI Entrance Exam pattern and marking scheme and prepare accordingly.
  3. Get all the study material for Jamia Millia Islamia Entrance Exams such as prep books and previous years' question papers to help better understand what to expect in the exam.
  4. Create a monthly timetable on how much material to cover daily.
  5. Solve question papers, sample papers and mock tests.

Candidates must prepare every topic from preparation books as it will clear doubts and will help in understanding the subjects thoroughly. Some of the top preparation books are listed below:

Q:   How can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

Aspiring students are required to register on the official website of CUET fill the application form online. In the form, fill all the details asked, upload the required documents and pay the application fee. Starting 2022, for BA, BSc and BVoc, JMI started accepting the scores of CUET UG. For the same, students need to register for the exam, appear for it and qualify it. Qualified students of CUET UG are required to register for JMI counselling after which merit lists will be released with the name of the shortlisted students. For the remaining courses, however, the university is still accepting national and university-level entrance exam for final selection. 

Upvote

Q:   Is B.Sc available in Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI)?

A: 

Yes, JMI offers both BSc and BSc (Hons) programmes across four and five specialisations, respectively. The admission process for both these programmes is conducted through JMI entrance test and the final selection of candidates is based on their performance in previous qualifying degree exams, performance in the entrance test and seat availability. But before everything else, students must meet the minimum eligibility requirements set by the university which is passing Class 12 with at least 50% aggregate with a relevant combination of subjects, such as Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics and/ or Biology, among others. 

Upvote

Q:   Can I get into JMI for BA without CUET?

A: 

As per the CUET UG website, students seeking admission to BA at Jamia Millia must appear for and qualify CUET exam. However, since some universities are also considering other components while giving admission to CUET-UG based courses, it could be a possibility of getting into JMI without CUET. But, this being said there is no official information on whether the university will only consider CUET UG scores or other components as well for admission, it is tough to give the right answer. Students are therefore advised to reach out to the admission office for more details. 

Upvote

Q:   What is the cutoff for BTech in Computer Engineering at Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI] for EWS and PWD categories?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia BTech cutoff 2023 for Computer Science Engineering was 53885 for PWD category. While the admissions are based on the scores/rank obtained in JEE Main, the last cut offs also change a lot depending on All India quota or Home State. It also varies if the applicant is a female.

Upvote

Q:   I want to pursue MBA from Jamia Millia Islamia. Is it a good university to pursue MBA?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia is a renowned university and offers a two-year Master of Business Administration (MBA) programme. The success of doing an MBA from Jamia Millia Islamia or any other university depends on several factors such as the quality of the course, the reputation of the university, placement opportunities that students get from that university.

  • Reputation: Every year, companies, such as Honda, Accenture, FedEx, Tata, HDFC Bank, Zomato and Adobe visit the campus of Jamia Millia Islamia to hire the students of MBA as mentioned by a few students in their verified students reviews' on Shiksha. Participation of such top-notch companies proove that Jamia is a reputed name in the industry for its MBA education.
  • Quality of MBA: To furtnish the quality aspect of MBA from Jamia, the MBA course of Jamia Millia Islamia is accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA) and is recognised by the University Grants Commission (UGC).
  • Opportunities to the students: As per the details collated from various sources on the internet, students who actively participate in extracurricular activities, internships, and networking opportunities are know to have a more successful career after completing the MBA programme from here. Every year, 70-90% students get jobs from the campus and the salary packages ranges between INR 4 LPA to INR 13 LPA. 

As per the above factors, an MBA from Jamia Millia Islamia can be counted as a valuable asset for individuals looking to advance their career in the field of Business and Management considering they are ready to put in their efforts and hadwork in the course duration. 

Upvote

Q:   Has JMI CUET-UG counselling started?

A: 

For admission 2022, Jamia Milia Islamia was accepting applications for CUET-UG counselling for undergraduate courses till Sep 26. The registration window closed as per the set schedule followed by the release of seat allotment results/merit list for different courses. For admission 2023, the application process for CUET UG took place between February and March and the further admission process will be conducted after the release of the CUET UG result. However, this stay tuned to this page for further updates on the same.

Q:   What is the fee for MBA at Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

The total tuition fee for MBA at Jamia Millia Islamia ranges between INR 38,500 - INR 3 lakh. The range indicates that the fee across all MBA specialisations is different. In addition to the tuition fee, students are also required to pay the application form charges which is INR 700 for the course. The afore-mentioned tution fee, however, is sourced from various sources on the internet. Hence, is indicative. For the exact fee and specialisation-wise fee break-up for different MBA specialisations, students can reach out to the admission office or check out the JMI Official Prospectus 2023-24.

Q:   Is BTech at Jamia Millia Islamia good?

A: 

The answer to whether BTech from Jamia Millia Islamia is good or not depends on a lot of factors. All these factors are listed below one after another:

  • Specialisations: BTech at Jamia is available across the five most common specialisations, namely, Civil, Computer, Electrical, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Engineering. In a world where more in-depth specialisations, such as Data Science, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are trending the university still sticks to the basic courses. For students looking out for core information on the trending areas of AI and ML, it can't be considered a good option. But in case, a student wishes to stay with the traditional branches, Jamia Millia Islamia can be a good option.
  • Placements: Another factor that comes into consideration while choosing a college for a course is its return on investment value. The same can be calculated basis of the kind of placements offered to the students. As per the data collated from the verified students' reviews on Shikhsa, the majority of students mention that 70-90% of BTech students get placement opportunities from Jamia.  Additionally, the salary packages start from INR 3-4 LPA as the lowest and go up to even INR 25 Lacs per annum for some students. 
  • Fee: While the general fee for BTech ranges from INR 2 to 5 Lacs per annum for colleges in India, Jamia Millia Islamia charges INR 16,150 annually for its BTech programme which is extremely low. Hence, concerning the fee, Jamia Millia Islamia is a great option for BTech. 

Based on the factors mentioned above and the requirements of candidates, they can decide whether they want to go ahead with Jamia Millia Islamia for BTech or not. Read more about BTech reviews from Jamia Millia Islamia students here. 

Upvote

Q:   What is the admission process at Jamia Millia Islamia for B.Arch?

A: 
The admission process for Bachelor of Architecture B.Arch may vary from college to college, but generally, the following steps are involved: Eligibility: The candidate must have completed 10+2 or equivalent with mathematics as a compulsory subject and obtained a minimum of 50% marks (45% for reserved categories). Entrance exam: The candidate must have appeared for the National Aptitude Test in Architecture NATA or the Joint Entrance Examination JEE Main Paper-2 conducted by the National Testing Agency NTA to be eligible for admission. Application: The candidate must fill the application form of the respective college or university they wish to apply to. The application form may be available online or offline. The application fee also needs to be paid. Merit list: Based on the NATA or JEE Main Paper-2 score and other eligibility criteria, the college or university releases a merit list of selected candidates. Counseling: Selected candidates are called for counseling or interview rounds to further evaluate their eligibility for admission. Admission: The candidate must pay the admission fee and complete the admission process, which may include document verification, seat confirmation, and submission of required documents. As for the admission form, you can obtain it from the respective college or university's official website or admission office. You can fill the form online or download it and submit it offline. Be sure to check the deadline for submission of the form and other important dates related to the admission process.

Q:   Is Jamia Millia Islamia admission 2023 closed?

A: 

The process of application for all coures to JMI now stands closed. For the 2023 entrance exam, the counselling session was scheduled to begin from the second week of August once the JMI entrance result was declared for all programmes. The JMI entrance results are released online and in the form of a merit list. Selected candidates are required to complete their admission formalities on or before the date notified in the admission schedule. Candidates will be required to bring the admit card of Jamia Millia Islamia Entrance exam and attested copies of the required documents. JMI counselling 2023 is conducted separately for different courses on different dates.

Upvote

Q:   What documents are required while appearing for JMI Entrance Exam counselling?

A: 

Selected candidates are advised to complete their admission formalities when the schedule is released. Students are required to bring their Admit Card issued for the Entrance Test and attested copies of the following documents, along with the originals, at the time of admission.

  • Registration Form    
  • Two recent passport size photographs
  • Proof of passing the qualifying examination along with the marksheets
  • Proof of Permanent Address with the name of the nearest police station and district
  • Certificate from a doctor or hospital certifying blood group
  • Proof of Age
  • Character Certificate from the institution last attended
  • Category certificate (If applicable)
  • Certificate/Affidavit from gazetted officer (in case of gap period)
  • Result of qualifying examination
Upvote

Q:   What is the age limit for Jamia Millia Islamia BA?

A: 

 The top universities in India have set upper or lower age limits for admission to their courses. However, Jamia Millia Islamia has not imposed any such age restrictions. There is no upper age limit to appear in the JMI 2023 exam. However, candidates securing the same rank and marks in JMI exam will be given preference, if they are higher in age than the others. For more details on Jamia Millia Islamia BA courses, its eligibility and selection, click here. 

Upvote

Q:   How many entrance exam cutoffs will be released for admission to BDS at Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI]?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI] will release 4-5 rounds of NEET cutoffs for admission to medical courses. The cutoffs will be released on a rolling basis, and the seats will be filled on a first-come, first-served basis. The cutoffs will be based on the following factors:

  • The NEET score of the candidate
  • The category of the candidate
  • The number of seats available in the course

Candidates must visit the official website of entrance exam to read clear instructions on how to proceed with the counselling process, once the round is released.

Upvote

Q:   Can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI] in BDS if my rank is between 35000 and 40000?

A: 

For last year, the closing rank for Discontinued (Jan 2023)- Bachelor of Dental Surgery (BDS) was 35224 which is very close to this range. This was for general category under All India quota. Unless the candidate belongs to some other category or domicile, one cannot afford to score less than this. With this rank, there is a probability of getting admission however since, the cut offs keep changing year on year, it is advisable to try to score better ranks to increase your chances of getting admission in Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI].

Upvote

Q:   What is the reservation percentage for Muslim candidates at JMI?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia offers seat reservations in almost all the courses based on the category of the students. Candidates seeking JMI admission under the reserved category can apply for reservation under one category only and are required to fulfil the prescribed eligibility conditions of the course. More details regarding JMI reservation criteria are enlisted below:

  • 30% of the total number of seats in each course are reserved for Muslim applicants. 10% of the total number of seats in each course are reserved for women applicants
    who are Muslims and 10% of the total number of seats in each course shall be earmarked for (OBCs) and ST students who are Muslims.
  • 5% of seats in all the courses are reserved for physically challenged students.
  • 5% of seats in all courses must be filled by internal students of Jamia who have passed their qualifying exam from Jamia schools as regular students.

More details on the reservation criteria and relaxation offered to students across course eligibility are available in the official 2023 prospectus of JMI.

Upvote

Q:   What is the opening and closing rank for BTech in Computer Engineering at Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI)?

A: 

Opening and Closing rank depends on the category and quota of candidates. For General category under All India, opening rank was 7216 and closing rank was 7216. Cut off are differant when it comes to other categories or female candidates and even domicile of home state. Admission to the B.Tech in Computer Engineering in Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI] is based on the scores obtained in the entrance exam JEE. Applicants are advised to first confirm the category in which they are applying and then check the cut-offs.

Upvote

Q:   What is the NEET cut off for BDS in Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI]?

A: 

For 2022, cut off was 35224 for General category candidates in All India quota for Discontinued (Jan 2023)- Bachelor of Dental Surgery (BDS) in Jamia Millia Islamia [JMI]. NEET cut off varies depending on the category and domicile/quota of the applicant.

Upvote

Q:   What is the procedure for JMI admission to a distance learning course?

A: 

For admission to any distance learning course at JMI, candidates need to download the application form from the official website of Jamia Millia Islamia. The duly downloaded and completed application form has to be submitted to the respective Programme Coordinator, CDOL, Jamia Millia Islamia, New Delhi or selected Learner Support Centre. The application form has to be accompanied by an application fee in the form of a Demand Draft drawn in favour of “Jamia Millia Islamia payable at New Delhi.” The application fee for all the distance learning programmes (except MBA & B.Ed) is INR 500, while for MBA and B.Ed programme, it is INR 700.

Upvote

Q:   What is the last date of JMI admission 2023?

A: 

The 2023 schedule for Jamia Millia Islamia entrance exam was out early in the year. The entrance exam started taking place Apr 15 onward. For the same, students were able to fill out the JMI Entrance application form between Mar 4 and Apr 3. In case students wish to make any changes to the application form, the same was open between Apr 4 and Apr 6. After that, the JMI Entrance admit card was out on Apr 10 and then students can appear for the exam. Any changes in the timelines will be updated here once out. All the students who will appear for this exam must note that the last date for submitting the qualifying exam result is Sep 30. For more details on the JMI admission timelines, check out the official website. 

Upvote

Q:   When the JMI Entrance Exam answer key is released?

A: 
The JMI Entrance Exam 2023 answer key and the response sheet of candidates are made available online on the admission result page within three working days after the JMI Entrance Exam is over. Candidates can compare their responses with the JMI answer key and calculate the estimated score. Challenges against the answer key can be submitted within 48 hours after the answer key is uploaded. After downloading the answer key, candidates should assign the marks allotted to a particular question if they have marked it correctly. If the answer happens to be incorrect, they should deduct the marks assigned for the wrong answer. The score can be calculated based on the number of answers marked correctly in the exam.
Upvote

Q:   What is the fee of Jamia Millia Islamia for the BA programme?

A: 

The total tuition fee for BA and BA (Hons) programmes at Jamia Millia Islamia ranges between INR 20,100 and INR 45,000. This fee, however, is sourced from unofficial sources. Hence, is indicative. For the specialisation-wise break-up of fee for BA and B (Hons) courses, students are advised to check out the official brochure of Jamia Millia Islamia 2023.
